message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) as it deals with word embeddings and latent topics, which are commonly used in NLP tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, and information retrieval. It could also belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) as it proposes a framework for jointly learning word embeddings and latent topics, which involves training a neural network model. Information Retrieval (cs.IR) is another likely sub-category as the paper mentions learning term distributions and topic distributions, which are important for IR tasks such as document ranking and clustering. Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is also a possibility as the paper deals with learning representations of words and topics, which are fundamental to many AI applications. Finally, Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) could be a relevant sub-category as the paper proposes a novel framework for learning word embeddings and latent topics, which involves designing and implementing efficient algorithms for training the model.
